titles.title: Recognizing the commitment and efforts made by the Library of Congress to promote the joy of reading through the sponsorship of the National Book Festival.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mrs. Davis (CA) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1646.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/28/2010--Passed House without amendment. Recognizes the commitment and efforts made by the Library of Congress to promote the joy of reading through the sponsorship of the National Book Festival. Recognizes and emphasizes the important historic and ongoing role of the Library of Congress in organizing and running the National Book Festival. Encourages all Americans to celebrate the 10th National Book Festival, "A Decade of Words and Wonder."
